page.title: 01The Village
page.content: It is a small quiet village just two miles north of Thirsk.There is one main road through the village.In the centre of the village is Saint Wilfred's church built in the 12th century.It only has a bit of stained glass.The graveyard is quite small. Just outside the church is the village green where on bonfire night the village bonfire is held. There is one junction it is near the green.Along that road there are some new houses on the right and some older semi-detatched houses on the left.If you keep going you come to Upsall.The road to Upsall is quiet and the fields on each side are used mainly for crops. Just after the junction on the left there are some detatched houses and a few semi-detatched houses a woodwork shop and goats milk for sale and a bed
